page.title: 12PARACHUTING AT FORTON
page.content: Parachuting has taken place at this disused ex-World War II airfield for many years now. People come from all over the Midlands for a week-end course which costs around Â£50 and leads to the first jump. Subsequent jumps cost around Â£8 each. Part of a group from Shrewsbury VI College can be seen on the accompanying photograph about to take off on their first jump. A large number of first timers raise money for charity as a result of their exploits - and get their first jump paid for by their sponsors. The more hardened addicts of this fast growing sport can be seen here every week-end that the weather and finances will allow. Certainly, all who have tried this sport reckon it is an experience you will never forget - one way or another!
